title: Uzbekistan Airways to weigh passengers in new 'flight safety' measure
text:
Save 
Passengers travelling with Ukbekistan’s national carrier is planning to weigh passengers with their hand luggage before boarding flights. 
Those travelling with Uzbekistan Airways will reportedly be directed to a “special weighing machine” at the departure gate, to determine each person’s average weight with their hand baggage, Telegraph Travel said. 
The airline said individual passengers’ weights would not be disclosed, and that “full confidentiality of results is guaranteed”, with the weighing machine only categorising passengers by sex and into adult and child groups. 
The company said in a statement: “According to the rules of International Air Transport Association, airlines are obliged to carry out the regular procedures of preflight control passengers weighing with hand baggage to observe requirements for ensuring flight safety”. 
The carrier has not however made it clear whether larger passengers would be charged a fee. 
It is also not clear whether measures would be taken if the total weight of the passengers and their hand luggage exceeded an aircraft’s weight limit and guidelines. 
A report by the World Health Organisation in 2008 found that more than 44% of those aged 20 and older were overweight, and nearly 15% were found to be obese.
